definition: to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)

sentences.english: B. The college I applied to has accepted me.
sentences.chinese: 我报了名的学院已经录取了我。

sentences.english: The Texas system challenged by Ms. Fisher is idiosyncratic.
sentences.chinese: 受到费舍女士挑战的德克萨斯录取系统非常特别。

sentences.english: Lin Bing was enrolled by University of Massachusetts.
sentences.chinese: 林冰同学被麻州大学录取。

sentences.english: Total first-time enrolment of international graduate students rose 12 per cent this year.
sentences.chinese: 新录取的国际研究生总人数今年增加了12%。

sentences.english: The admission notice he received from the university rejoiced his mother's heart.
sentences.chinese: 他收到的大学录取通知书使他的母亲心花怒放。

sentences.english: Because your life was transformed by this letter of acceptance, ? right?
sentences.chinese: 因为你的人生被这封录取信改变，没错吧？

sentences.english: If the inviter is studying in Canada, a letter of acceptance from the school.
sentences.chinese: 如果邀请人在加学习，校方出具的录取信。

sentences.english: and you know, you are pretty smart, I think you will do well.
sentences.chinese: 又聪明的话，我想你一定可以被录取的。

sentences.english: But he tried a third time, was accepted and marched into the history books.
sentences.chinese: 但他做了第三次尝试，最终被录取并且名垂青史。

sentences.english: The chief method is to take depositions of parties and witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 主要的方法是录取当事人和证人的宣誓证言。

sentences.english: A: I just received the acceptance notification from the university I had applied for.
sentences.chinese: 我刚刚收到我申请的那所大学的录取通知书。

sentences.english: and then they make you an offer saying you have to achieve these grades.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他们会给你录取通知，说你要达到这些等级。

sentences.english: Could you tell us what kind of process you went through to come here?
sentences.chinese: 能和我们谈谈你被这所学校录取经历了怎样的过程吗？

sentences.english: I was very excited when I accepted the admission notice from the postman.
sentences.chinese: 我从邮递员手中接过录取通知书，心情非常激动。

sentences.english: David was admitted to one of the famous universities in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 大卫被北京的一所着名大学录取了。

sentences.english: She was admitted to the university.

definition: to enter oneself for an examination
horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
to enroll new students/to get students
to pass a university entrance exam
to advertise an entrance examination for an academic institution (old)
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)
